thread.title: Trump Russia dossier author breaks his cover
thread.title_full: Trump Russia dossier author breaks his cover

title: Trump Russia dossier author breaks his cover
text:
Trump Russia dossier author Christopher Steele speaks out By James Masters Updated 1655 GMT (0055 HKT) March 7, 2017 
Chat with us in Facebook Messenger. Find out what's happening in the world as it unfolds. Trump dossier author Christopher Steele has returned to work in London. (CNN) The former British intelligence agent who compiled a dossier of allegations President Donald Trump's ties to Russia has spoken for the first time since his report reverberated around the world. Christopher Steele, a former officer with MI6, the UK's foreign intelligence service, returned to work in London Tuesday, almost two months after CNN first reported on the dossier. The file, contained claims that Russian operatives had compromising personal and financial information about Trump. Trump always denied the claims, dismissing them as "phony" in January. "I'm really pleased to be back here working again," Steele told the UK Press Association outside the office of his firm, London-based Orbis Intelligence. "I'm now going to be focusing my efforts on supporting the broader interests of our company here." Read More Steele was named as the man behind the report days after CNN first reported that Trump had been briefed on its contents as President-elect in January. "I'd like to say a warm thank you to everyone who sent me kind messages and support over the last few weeks," Steele said. "Just to add, I won't be making any further statements or comments at this time."
